snippet: The issue gained urgency after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared in March with 239 people aboard.
abstract: Airlines, governments, pilots and aircraft manufacturers, meeting at conference, reach wide agreement on need for a global system for tracking commercial aircraft; parties sidestep key question of whether aircrews should be able to turn off such equipment; issue gained urgency following disappearance of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.
lead_paragraph: The issue gained urgency after Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 disappeared in March with 239 people aboard.

headline.main: Groups Back Global Plan for Tracking Commercial Flights
headline.print_headline: Groups Back Global Plan for Tracking Public Flights
